intro: Chaerophyllum villosum, commonly known as hairy chaerophyllum, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that bloom in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in meadows and woodland areas. Its hairy texture and delicate appearance make it a distinctive member of its genus.
